question:
Consider the following about Vote on account:
  1. Vote on account is the interim permission of the parliament to the government to spend money
  2. It does not contain any direct tax proposals anyway
Which of the above is / are correct?
explanation: Vote on account is the interim permission of the parliament to the government to spend money. It usually does not contain any direct tax proposals. Therefore, any decrease/increase or exemption/inclusion related to income tax will be on hold if thereâ€™s a vote on account.
